overview:
Jamil most recently was an EIR for Signia Venture Partners, leading game investor Rick Thompson’s venture firm. Jamil worked with Rick in assisting existing investments, evaluating potential investments, and developing new ventures. Prior to that, Jamil was the Vice President of Business Development for Funzio, a leader in developing blockbuster free-to-play games for mobile and social platforms, including iOS, Android, Facebook, and Google+. The company was acquired by GREE, and Jamil stayed on as VP BD GREE. While at Funzio, Jamil managed platform and partner strategy, headed marketing and communications, and served on the executive team. Previously as Director of Business Development for EA Partners, Jamil sought out innovative developers, advocated them through the Electronic Artsâ€™ executive green-light process, and managed the business of the games he signed. While there, he created EA Partners’ third party digital publishing business, signing the best creative indie game developers to cross-platform digital distribution deals. Prior to Electronic Arts, he was the Executive Director of the Game Developers Conference, where he managed the overall business of the event and curated the editorial content of the conference and keynotes.

Jamil is also a trustee of the IGDA Foundation, an advisor to Casual Connect and other game industry organizations, co-author of an industry commentary blog with Shawn Foust at SoMoFos.com and the author of Tearing the Sky, a science fiction novel.
